comment: Teacher is FANTASTIC. She has very in-depth knowledge on linguistics  The material was easy to follow along with and the teacher broke down everything in a way that anyone can understand. Made learning Chinese less daunting and easier to do

Watch a movie every week and quiz over it. had to do presentation on one of the films which you were assigned to. Final is a paper 8 pages in length including refrences. very caring. movies were good especially at the end. midterm was a normal test. would take her again for this class

Amazing Professor. Class could be tough sometimes, but she always pushes you to be your best. If you are serious about Chinese take this class, if you're looking for an easy A probably don't. 100% would take again

Jin laoshi is so inspirational, supportive, smart, and fun and she loves what she does which makes students actually want to come to every class and learn. She wants you to be better and will always inspire you to grow and be the best and not just average. She will always be one of my favorite professors.

I loved Jin laoshi. A lot of material was covered every class. We also did speaking exercises every class to cement the new material. She was very personable and genuinely cared about each student. She offers extra credit for attending various events throughout the semester. If you do the homework and study guides it's an easy class

Jin laoshi is an awesome professor. She is passionate about Chinese and her students and will do whatever she can to help you out. Chinese requires effort, but if you put it in you will receive the reward. She will stay on you about being in class for this reason.

Jin laoshi is a great professor and I regret that I can't take her for all of my chinese classes (transferring). She definitely cares about her students a lot more than other professors. Go to class. Take advantage of her office hours as she is very helpful when you go to her office. GO TO THE LANGUAGE LAB REGULARLY. You get help and extra credit.

Jin lao shi is amazing! She's very energetic and genuinely wants students to be interested in learning Chinese. She encourages students to engage in class and guides her students very well if needed. She goes pretty fast so you need to go home and study on your own after class. There are quizzes almost everyday. Remember practice makes perfect!

She is a great teacher, I wish I had more time to take 2002. You do need to put effort in if you are serious about learning Mandarin, but she is by far one of the best teachers I have ever had at KSU, great guidance.

Amazing is def. the word for Jin Laoshi. My only complaint is that she isn't teaching every Chinese class at KSU-- I have been taking Chinese a few years and I have never learned so much Chinese from a professor before. She has a great sense of humor and I love her as a person. I will really miss this class.

Jin laoshi is an amazing professor! Quizzes each class help solidify the vocabulary. Class lectures are more devoted towards understanding grammar and usage. As long as you have an interest in the language and show true effort, Jin laoshi will make sure you understand. Also makes use of Chinese cartoons to learn idioms - fun!
Makes it easy to understand and is fair. As long as you do the work and study your vocab can easily make an A.

Wonderful teacher. She has a background in linguistics which helps her with her clarity a lot. She is nice and helpful and there's nobody I could recommend more for this class. Just work hard and keep at it.

Dr. Jin is an amazing teacher! I admit her class is not an easy pass at all. There's quizzes every class over vocab. You cannot slack off or be lazy in this class. Despite all that, she's one of the best language teachers I've ever had. MEMORIZE AND STUDY THE STUDY GUIDES FOR EACH TEST. Her study guide is basically the same thing as her test.
Professor Jin is a great teacher but this class takes a lot of time!  You should expect for 8-10 hours a week outside of the classroom to do remotely well in this class.

Jin laoshi is a very nice lady, and a native speaker.  There is a lot of information that is given out very quickly.  She tries to make sure everyone in class understands the material covered.  Attendance is a must, 3 absences=1 grade point.  Quizzes pretty much every day.  The review sheet for tests are important, questions on review are on test.

Attendance is mandatory, 3 absences and you lose a grade point.  She goes over material really fast, but that's probably the course.  She's really funny and nice and seems to want everyone to understand clearly.  The test reviews are important, questions from the review will be on the test.  Quiz pretty much every day, so expect it.

I LOVE Jin Laoshi! She pushed us a lot but her way of teaching Chinese is extremely effective. She keeps the class entertaining and you will always learn something. She challenges you but is reasonable with her grading. Easily one of the best professors in the Foreign Language Department.
A difficult class, but laoshi Jin's a great teacher. You learn a lot in her class. Just make sure you attend, pay attention, study, and do the homework!
